intro: Alphonsea kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu alphonsea, is a tropical tree native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a fleshy drupe that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species. The tree is often found in secondary forests and is adapted to the humid, high-altitude conditions of its native habitat.
